content:
ListCollectionView Class

Definition

Represents the collection view for collections that implement IList.

In this Article

public class ListCollectionView : System.Windows.Data.CollectionView, System.Collections.IComparer, System.ComponentModel.ICollectionViewLiveShaping, System.ComponentModel.IEditableCollectionViewAddNewItem, System.ComponentModel.IItemProperties
Inheritance
Object
DispatcherObject
System.Windows.Data.CollectionView
ListCollectionView

Remarks

When you bind to a data collection, you may want to sort, filter, or group the data. To do that, you use collection views. You can think of a CollectionView as the layer on top of the binding source collection that allows you to navigate and display the source collection based on sort, filter, and group queries, all without having to manipulate the underlying source collection itself. If the source collection implements the INotifyCollectionChanged interface, the changes raised by the CollectionChanged event are propagated to the views.

All collections have a default CollectionView. For all collections implementing IList, the ListCollectionView object is the default view object. The BindingListCollectionView is the collection view class used for collections that implement IBindingList. To get the default view, you use the GetDefaultView method. For an example, see How to: Get the Default View of a Data Collection.

For more information about collection views, see Data Binding Overview.

Constructors

ListCollectionView(IList)

Initializes a new instance of the ListCollectionView class, using a supplied collection that implements IList.

public ListCollectionView (System.Collections.IList list);
list
IList

The underlying collection, which must implement IList.

Properties

ActiveComparer

Gets or sets the current active comparer that is used in sorting.

protected System.Collections.IComparer ActiveComparer { get; set; }
Value
IComparer

An IComparer object that is the active comparer.

ActiveFilter

Gets or sets the current active stem.Windows.Data.CollectionView.Filter* callback.

protected Predicate<object> ActiveFilter { get; set; }
Value
Predicate<Object>

The active stem.Windows.Data.CollectionView.Filter* callback.

CanAddNew

Gets a value that indicates whether a new item can be added to the collection.

public bool CanAddNew { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if a new item can be added to the collection; otherwise, false.

Remarks

The ListCollectionView can create a new item for the collection if there is no edit transaction occurring, if the collection is not a fixed size, and if the ListCollectionView can create an object of the correct type.

CanAddNewItem

Gets a value that indicates whether a specified object can be added to the collection.

public bool CanAddNewItem { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if a specified object can be added to the collection; otherwise, false.

Remarks

If the CanAddNewItem property is true, you can specify an object to add to the collection by calling the AddNewItem method. CanAddNewItem is false if items cannot be added to the collection.

CanCancelEdit

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view can discard pending changes and restore the original values of an edited object.

public bool CanCancelEdit { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the collection view can discard pending changes and restore the original values of an edited object; otherwise, false.

Remarks

CanCancelEdit is true if the edited item implements the System.ComponentModel.IEditableObject interface. If CanCancelEdit is false, call CancelEdit to cause the view to exit the edit state and provide logic to revert the changes on the object that was edited.

CanChangeLiveFiltering

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports turning filtering data in real time on or off.

public bool CanChangeLiveFiltering { get; }
Value
Boolean

true in all cases.

CanChangeLiveGrouping

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports turning grouping data in real time on or off.

public bool CanChangeLiveGrouping { get; }
Value
Boolean

true in all cases.

CanChangeLiveSorting

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports turning sorting data in real time on or off.

public bool CanChangeLiveSorting { get; }
Value
Boolean

true in all cases.

CanFilter

Gets a value that indicates whether the view supports callback-based filtering.

public override bool CanFilter { get; }
Value
Boolean

For a default instance of ListCollectionView, this property always returns true.

Remarks

Use this property to test whether the current implementation supports filtering before assigning a callback to the inherited Filter property.

CanGroup

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports grouping.

public override bool CanGroup { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the collection view supports grouping; otherwise, false.

CanRemove

Gets a value that indicates whether an item can be removed from the collection.

public bool CanRemove { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if an item can be removed from the collection; otherwise, false.

Remarks

CanRemove is true if the collection is not a fixed size and if an add or edit transaction is not occurring.

CanSort

Gets a value that indicates whether the collection view supports sorting.

public override bool CanSort { get; }
Value
Boolean

For a default instance of ListCollectionView, this property always returns true.

Count

Gets the estimated number of records.

public override int Count { get; }
Value
Int32

One of the following:

Value
 Meaning
-1
 Could not determine the count of the collection. This might be returned by a "virtualizing" view, where the view deliberately does not account for all items in the underlying collection because the view is trying to increase efficiency and minimize dependence on always having the whole collection available.
any other integer
 The count of the collection.

Remarks

Note that this count represents the filtered count.

CurrentAddItem

Gets the item that is being added during the current add transaction.

public object CurrentAddItem { get; }
Value
Object

The item that is being added if stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.IsAddingNew* is true; otherwise, null.

CurrentEditItem

Gets the item in the collection that is being edited.

public object CurrentEditItem { get; }
Value
Object

The item in the collection that is being edited if stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.IsEditingItem* is true; otherwise, null.

CustomSort

Gets or sets a custom object that implements IComparer to sort items in the view.

public System.Collections.IComparer CustomSort { get; set; }
Value
IComparer

The sort criteria as an implementation of IComparer.

Remarks

Setting this property causes an immediate refresh unless a DeferRefresh is in effect.

Setting this property clears a previously set SortDescriptions value.

Filter

Gets or sets a method that is used to determine whether an item is suitable for inclusion in the view.

public override Predicate<object> Filter { get; set; }
Value
Predicate<Object>

A delegate that represents the method that is used to determine whether an item is suitable for inclusion in the view.

GroupBySelector

Gets or sets a delegate to select the GroupDescription as a function of the parent group and its level.

public virtual System.Windows.Data.GroupDescriptionSelectorCallback GroupBySelector { get; set; }
Value
GroupDescriptionSelectorCallback

A method that provides the logic for the selection of the GroupDescription as a function of the parent group and its level. The default value is null.

GroupDescriptions

Gets a collection of GroupDescription objects that describe how the items in the collection are grouped in the view.

public override System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection<System.ComponentModel.GroupDescription> GroupDescriptions { get; }
Value
ObservableCollection<GroupDescription>

A collection of GroupDescription objects that describe how the items in the collection are grouped in the view.

Remarks

Note

This property can only be set by accessing the collection object and using its various methods such as Add. The property to access the collection object itself is read-only; the collection itself is read/write.

Groups

Gets the top-level groups.

public override System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyObservableCollection<object> Groups { get; }
Value
ReadOnlyObservableCollection<Object>

A read-only collection of the top-level groups, or null if there are no groups.

Remarks

The items in the collection are of type CollectionViewGroup.

InternalCount

Gets the number of records in the stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.InternalList*.

protected int InternalCount { get; }
Value
Int32

The number of records in the stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.InternalList*.

InternalList

Gets the complete and unfiltered underlying collection.

protected System.Collections.IList InternalList { get; }
Value
IList

The underlying collection, which must implement IList.

IsAddingNew

Gets a value that indicates whether an add transaction is in progress.

public bool IsAddingNew { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if an add transaction is in progress; otherwise, false.

Remarks

You begin an add transaction by calling the AddNew method, and you end the add transaction by calling CommitNew or CancelNew.

IsDataInGroupOrder

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the list of items (after applying the sort and filters, if any) is already in the correct order for grouping.

public bool IsDataInGroupOrder { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

true if the list of items is already in the correct order for grouping; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Setting this property to true informs the view that the list of items is already in the correct order for grouping and allows the view to use a more efficient algorithm to build the groups. The data is in the correct order if:

  1. All items belonging to a given group appear consecutively, and

  2. If the GroupNames collection is non-empty, the groups in GroupNames appear before any other groups, and in the same order as in GroupNames.

IsEditingItem

Gets a value that indicates whether an edit transaction is in progress.

public bool IsEditingItem { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if an edit transaction is in progress; otherwise, false.

Remarks

You begin an edit transaction by calling the EditItem method, and you end the transaction by calling CommitEdit or CancelEdit.

IsEmpty

Returns a value that indicates whether the resulting (filtered) view is empty.

public override bool IsEmpty { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if the resulting view is empty; otherwise, false.

IsGrouping

Gets a value that indicates whether there are groups in the view.

protected bool IsGrouping { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if there are groups in the view; otherwise, false.

IsLiveFiltering

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether filtering data in real time is enabled.

public Nullable<bool> IsLiveFiltering { get; set; }
Value
Nullable<Boolean>

true if filtering data in real time is enabled; false if live filtering is not enabled; null if it cannot be determined whether the collection view implements live filtering.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

IsLiveFiltering cannot be set to null.

IsLiveGrouping

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether grouping data in real time is enabled.

public Nullable<bool> IsLiveGrouping { get; set; }
Value
Nullable<Boolean>

true if grouping data in real time is enabled; false if live grouping is not enabled; null if it cannot be determined whether the collection view implements live grouping.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

IsLiveGrouping cannot be set to null.

IsLiveSorting

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether sorting in real time is enabled.

public Nullable<bool> IsLiveSorting { get; set; }
Value
Nullable<Boolean>

true if sorting data in real time is enabled; false if live sorting is not enabled; null if it cannot be determined whether the collection view implements live sorting.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.IsLiveFiltering* cannot be set to null.

ItemProperties

Gets a collection of objects that describes the properties of the items in the collection.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<System.ComponentModel.ItemPropertyInfo> ItemProperties { get; }
Value
ReadOnlyCollection<ItemPropertyInfo>

A collection of objects that describes the properties of the items in the collection.

LiveFilteringProperties

Gets a collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in filtering data in real time.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection<string> LiveFilteringProperties { get; }
Value
ObservableCollection<String>

A collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in filtering data in real time.

LiveGroupingProperties

Gets a collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in grouping data in real time.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection<string> LiveGroupingProperties { get; }
Value
ObservableCollection<String>

A collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in grouping data in real time.

LiveSortingProperties

Gets a collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in sorting data in real time.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ObservableCollection<string> LiveSortingProperties { get; }
Value
ObservableCollection<String>

A collection of strings that specify the properties that participate in sorting data in real time.

NewItemPlaceholderPosition

Gets or sets the position of the new item placeholder in the ListCollectionView.

public System.ComponentModel.NewItemPlaceholderPosition NewItemPlaceholderPosition { get; set; }
Value
NewItemPlaceholderPosition

One of the enumeration values that specifies the position of the new item placeholder in the ListCollectionView.

SortDescriptions

Gets a collection of SortDescription objects that describes how the items in the collection are sorted in the view.

public override System.ComponentModel.SortDescriptionCollection SortDescriptions { get; }
Value
SortDescriptionCollection

A collection of SortDescription objects that describe how the items in the collection are sorted in the view.

Remarks

Note

This property can only be set by accessing the collection object and using its various methods such as Add. The property to access the collection object itself is read-only; the collection itself is read/write.

UsesLocalArray

Gets a value that indicates whether a private copy of the data is needed for sorting and filtering.

protected bool UsesLocalArray { get; }
Value
Boolean

true if a private copy of the data is needed for sorting and filtering; otherwise, false. The default implementation returns true if there is an stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.ActiveFilter* or stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.ActiveComparer*, or both.

Methods

AddNew()

Starts an add transaction and returns the pending new item.

public object AddNew ();
Returns
Object

The pending new item.

Remarks

Calling AddNew starts an add transaction. You should call CommitNew or CancelNew to end the add transaction. A new item always appears in the collection view. Any filtering, sorting, or grouping that is applied to the view is applied to the new item when CommitNew is called.

AddNewItem(Object)

Adds the specified object to the collection.

public object AddNewItem (object newItem);
newItem
Object

The object to add to the collection.

Returns
Object

The object that was added to the collection.

Exceptions
InvalidOperationException

An object cannot be added to the ListCollectionView by using the AddNewItem method.

Remarks

Calling the AddNewItem method starts an add transaction. You should call the CommitNew or CancelNew methods to end the add transaction. A new item always appears in the collection view. Any filtering, sorting, or grouping that is applied to the view is applied to the new item when CommitNew is called.

CancelEdit()

Ends the edit transaction, and if possible, restores the original value to the item.

public void CancelEdit ();

Remarks

CancelEdit sets CurrentEditItem to null and causes the collection view to exit the edit state. If CanCancelEdit is true, CancelEdit also restores the original values of the edited object.

CancelNew()

Ends the add transaction and discards the pending new item.

public void CancelNew ();

CommitEdit()

Ends the edit transaction and saves the pending changes.

public void CommitEdit ();

CommitNew()

Ends the add transaction and saves the pending new item.

public void CommitNew ();

Remarks

Any filtering, sorting, or grouping that is applied to the ListCollectionView is applied to the new item when CommitNew is called.

Compare(Object,Object)

Compares two objects and returns a value that indicates whether one is less than, equal to, or greater than the other.

protected virtual int Compare (object o1, object o2);
o1
Object

The first object to compare.

o2
Object

The second object to compare.

Returns
Int32

Less than zero if o1 is less than o2, zero if o1 and o2 are equal, or greater than zero if o1 is greater than o2.

Contains(Object)

Returns a value that indicates whether a given item belongs to the collection view.

public override bool Contains (object item);
item
Object

The object to check.

Returns
Boolean

true if the item belongs to the collection view; otherwise, false.

Remarks

This method does not make any assumptions about whether the item belongs to the underlying collection. If you know that the item belongs to the underlying collection, it is more efficient to call PassesFilter.

EditItem(Object)

Begins an edit transaction of the specified item.

public void EditItem (object item);
item
Object

The item to edit.

GetEnumerator()

Returns an object that you can use to enumerate the items in the view.

protected override System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An IEnumerator object that you can use to enumerate the items in the view.

Remarks

Enumerator instances are typically used for making asynchronous checks of the contents of a collection, or in this case, the contents of the view. For example, if you are about to start a foreach iteration over the contents of the view, it may be better to obtain an asynchronous copy to ensure that the length of the view items does not change unexpectedly midway through the loop.

GetItemAt(Int32)

Retrieves the item at the specified position in the view.

public override object GetItemAt (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index at which the item is located.

Returns
Object

The item at the specified position in the view.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

If index is out of range.

Remarks

This method evaluates the index with any SortDescriptions, GroupDescriptions, Filter, and CustomSort properties that are set on the view.

IndexOf(Object)

Returns the index where the given data item belongs in the collection, or -1 if the index of that item is unknown.

public override int IndexOf (object item);
item
Object

The object to check for in the collection.

Returns
Int32

The index of the item in the collection, or -1 if the item does not exist in the collection.

InternalContains(Object)

Return a value that indicates whether the stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.InternalList* contains the item.

protected bool InternalContains (object item);
item
Object

The item to locate.

Returns
Boolean

true if the stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.InternalList* contains the item; otherwise, false.

InternalGetEnumerator()

Returns an enumerator for the stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.InternalList*.

protected System.Collections.IEnumerator InternalGetEnumerator ();
Returns
IEnumerator

An enumerator for the stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.InternalList*.

InternalIndexOf(Object)

Returns the index of the specified item in the stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.InternalList*.

protected int InternalIndexOf (object item);
item
Object

The item to return an index for.

Returns
Int32

The index of the specified item in the stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.InternalList*.

InternalItemAt(Int32)

Returns the item at the given index in the stem.Windows.Data.ListCollectionView.InternalList*.

protected object InternalItemAt (int index);
index
Int32

The index at which the item is located.

Returns
Object

The item at the specified zero-based index in the view.

MoveCurrentToPosition(Int32)

Sets the item at the specified index to be the stem.Windows.Data.CollectionView.CurrentItem* in the view.

public override bool MoveCurrentToPosition (int position);
position
Int32

The index to set the stem.Windows.Data.CollectionView.CurrentItem* to.

Returns
Boolean

true if the resulting stem.Windows.Data.CollectionView.CurrentItem* is an item within the view; otherwise, false.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

Thrown if the index is out of range.

OnAllowsCrossThreadChangesChanged()

Occurs when the stem.Windows.Data.CollectionView.AllowsCrossThreadChanges* property changes.

protected override void OnAllowsCrossThreadChangesChanged ();

OnBeginChangeLogging(NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)

Called by the base class to notify the derived class that a CollectionChanged event has been posted to the message queue.

protected override void OnBeginChangeLogging (System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs args);
args
NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs

The NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs object that is added to the change log.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

If args is null.

Remarks

The purpose of this notification is to allow collection views to take a snapshot of the information, which is often the state of the data collection, that is needed at the time of the post.

PassesFilter(Object)

Returns a value that indicates whether the specified item in the underlying collection belongs to the view.

public override bool PassesFilter (object item);
item
Object

The item to check.

Returns
Boolean

true if the specified item belongs to the view or if there is not filter set on the collection view; otherwise, false.

Remarks

Unlike the Contains method, this method assumes that the specified item belongs to the underlying collection. This method takes filters into account. Typically, you use this method during collection-changed notifications to determine whether the added or removed item requires processing.

ProcessCollectionChanged(NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs)

Handles CollectionChanged events.

protected override void ProcessCollectionChanged (System.Collections.Specialized.NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs args);
args
NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs

The NotifyCollectionChangedEventArgs object to process.

Exceptions
ArgumentNullException

If args is null.

RefreshOverride()

Recreates the view.

protected override void RefreshOverride ();

Remove(Object)

Removes the specified item from the collection.

public void Remove (object item);
item
Object

The item to remove.

Remarks

If item is not in the collection, Remove does nothing.

RemoveAt(Int32)

Removes the item at the specified position from the collection.

public void RemoveAt (int index);
index
Int32

The zero-based index of the item to remove.

Exceptions
ArgumentOutOfRangeException

index is less than 0 or greater than the number of items in the collection view.

Remarks

index is relative to the collection view, not the collection. For example, if the collection has 10 items and the view has a Filter so that 7 items appear, the valid values of index are 0 through 6.

Explicit Interface Implementations

IComparer.Compare(Object,Object)

This member supports the Windows Presentation Foundation (WPF) infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

int IComparer.Compare (object o1, object o2);
o1
Object

The first object to compare.

o2
Object

The second object to compare.

Returns
Int32

A value that is less than zero means o1 is less than o2; a value of zero means the objects are equal; and a value that is over zero means o1 is greater than o2.
